{"step_by_step_thinking": "Parallel muscles have fibers that run parallel to each other and contract in the same direction. The Sartorius, Rectus Abdominis, and Tibialis Anterior are all examples of muscles with parallel fibers. The Sternohyoid, however, is a strap muscle, which is a type of muscle that has a more uniform width and parallel sides, but its fibers do not run parallel to each other.", "answer_choice": "C. Sternohyoid"}
